title: Hebrew (1888) Holy Bible in Hebrew - Greek
description: The 1888 edition of "The Holy Bible in the Original Hebrew and Greek" combines the Hebrew Old Testament edited by Meir (Max) Letteris with the Greek New Testament in the edition by Brooke Foss Westcott and Fenton John Anthony Hort. This compilation is notable for providing scholars and students with the biblical texts in their original languages. Letteris's version of the Hebrew Old Testament is a traditional and respected text, while the Westcott and Hort edition of the Greek New Testament is renowned for its critical approach to the Greek manuscripts. The merging of these two authoritative texts in one volume highlights the significance of studying the Bible in its original languages, offering a deeper understanding of the meanings and nuances in the texts. This edition serves as a crucial resource in biblical scholarship, bridging historical and contemporary studies of these foundational religious scriptures.
